trans-unit.source: App manifest does not have 'manifest' root element
trans-unit.target: App manifest does not have 'manifest' root element
trans-unit.note: The following are literal names and should not be translated: manifest

trans-unit.source: Must specify a package name or assembly name
trans-unit.target: Must specify a package name or assembly name
trans-unit.note: "package name" refers to the Java programming language "package" concept.

trans-unit.source: Could not determine Android SDK location. Please provide {0}.
trans-unit.target: Could not determine Android SDK location. Please provide {0}.
trans-unit.note: The following are literal names and should not be translated: Android SD {0} - the name of the C# method parameter causing an exception to be thrown.

trans-unit.source: Could not determine Java SDK location. Please provide {0}.
trans-unit.target: Could not determine Java SDK location. Please provide {0}.
trans-unit.note: The following are literal names and should not be translated: Java SDK {0} - the name of the C# method parameter causing an exception to be thrown.

trans-unit.source: Windows is not supported at this time.
trans-unit.target: Windows is not supported at this time.

trans-unit.source: No Microsoft OpenJDK could be found. Please re-run the Visual Studio installer or manually specify the JDK path in settings.
trans-unit.target: No Microsoft OpenJDK could be found. Please re-run the Visual Studio installer or manually specify the JDK path in settings.
trans-unit.note: The following are literal names and should not be translated: OpenJDK
{0} - the name of the C# method parameter causing an exception to be thrown.

trans-unit.source: Requested to get one string value when property `{0}` contains `{1}` values.
trans-unit.target: Requested to get one string value when property `{0}` contains `{1}` values.
trans-unit.note: {0} - a property name {1} - the number of values that {0} contains.

trans-unit.source: Could not find required file `{0}` within `{1}`; is this a valid JDK?
trans-unit.target: Could not find required file `{0}` within `{1}`; is this a valid JDK?
trans-unit.note: The following are literal names and should not be translated: JDK {0} - a file that is being looked. {1} - The directory where {0} is being looked for.
{0} - the value that is being processed, which is not understood.

trans-unit.source: The directory `{0}`, via locator `{1}`, is not a valid JDK directory: {2}
trans-unit.target: The directory `{0}`, via locator `{1}`, is not a valid JDK directory: {2}
trans-unit.note: {0} - a directory {1} - a "contextual" name for where {0} came from; from a config file? the registry? environment variable? etc. {2} - the `Exception.Message` from the exception prompting us to show this message.

trans-unit.source: Could not open or create key
trans-unit.target: Could not open or create key
trans-unit.note: "key" refers to a Windows Registry key

"registry key" refers to a Windows Registry key {0} - The return value of a `RegSetValueExW()` call {1} - The Windows registry key we're trying to set {2} - A Windows registry "subkey" {3} - The Windows registry key name {4} - The value we were trying to set

trans-unit.source: The program `{0}` returned non-zero exit code.
trans-unit.target: The program `{0}` returned non-zero exit code.
trans-unit.note: {0} - The name of the program which generated an error
